intro: Oenothera asperifolia, commonly known as the roughleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its medicinal and ornamental value. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits. Oenothera asperifolia thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
